message.content:
cs.IT, cs.COMM, cs.OH, cs.NI, cs.PHYS

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper deals with the performance analysis of a dual-hop transmission system, which involves the study of information transfer over a communication channel. The use of modulation schemes and the calculation of bit-error rate further supports this category.
2. cs.COMM (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper discusses the performance of a relay system, which is a common technique used in communication networks to extend the coverage area. The use of RF and FSO links also falls under this category.
3. cs.OH (Optimization and Control): The paper involves the study of the performance of a transmission system under the effect of pointing errors, which can be seen as a control problem. The optimization of the system performance can also be considered in this category.
4. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper deals with the performance analysis of a transmission system, which is a fundamental aspect of networking and internet architecture.
5. cs.PHYS (Physics and Society): The paper involves the study of the performance of a transmission system using both RF and FSO links, which can be seen as a physical phenomenon. The use of Gamma-Gamma and Nakagami-m fading channels also falls under this category.
